Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that is healthy and has enough water.
The student can illustrate a plant that does not have enough water and is not healthy.
The student can show the difference in plants' appearance with and without water.
The student can include signs of healthy growth, like green leaves or flowers, in their drawing of a plant with enough water.
The student can include signs of poor health, like wilting leaves or brown spots, in their drawing of a plant without enough water.
The student can use their drawing to show that plants need water to live and grow.
